column4: anyone know how to make my win key work? it used to work. now it doesnt. What do i do?
yes, win key
or u could call it that
thanks pelo
but its not working
i expect it to work
lol
what do you mean?
it is assigned to my compiz-fusion adn amarok and it dosnt work and should.
you can try the command "xev" it captures X events, so when pressing the Win key, you may see the name of the key or the way it responds to the X server.
key is not responding to that app
key is not responding to that xev
all other keys work okay? And Win Key/Super doesn't? That is weird. Then get a new keyboard.
use "dmesg" and see if it says something strange about your keyboard.  Did you upgrade the kernel recently?
you would be surprised how people ask windows questions in here. Ha ha.
I asked if you changed your kernel recently or some upgrade. Is it possible that a new driver for synaptics touchpad or something else has changed?
ya i was messing with the xorg.conf, i had to fix some settings in it recently., thats why i asked if it could be my xorg.conf earlier
I think I wasn't here when you talked about xorg.conf so maybe repeating that part will help.
could it possible be the keyboard layout?
102 is basic english I think and 105 has international symbols or something.
here is the keyboard section of my xorg.conf.  the only recently edited file that might affect the keyboard:     http://pastebin.com/m12e44c1e
I have one more line. I don't remember the details but maybe it is added by reconfiguring the X Server. But you can add it manually too. http://pastebin.com/m4245dcd2
I think that maybe a slow processor these days. I have a 3000+ but I really don't do anything CPU intensive.
please don't rant in here. It is considered trolling. I you wish to vent then go elsewhere. There is also #ubuntu-offtopic
